cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract concepts related to objective reality and its distinction from narrative invention, including facts, underlying truth, and the boundary between fact and fiction.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The line between fact and fiction is often blurred... ponder the truth behind the stories

members.entity_description: The conceptual boundary distinguishing objective truth from invented or embellished narrative, often blurred in storytelling.
Information or events considered objectively true and verifiable.
Actual reality or factual basis underlying the stories being told.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts distinguishing actual historical occurrences from invented or imagined story content, especially where narratives blur the line between truth and fabrication.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The line between fact and fiction is often blurred in these tales.

members.entity_description: Actual historical or factual occurrences that may underlie some stories.
Invented or imagined content within stories, contrasting with factual material.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to narrative explanations of unknown or supernatural phenomena across history, including the stories themselves and the broad historical periods in which they arose.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Origins of urban legends in ancient times when stories explained the unknown and supernatural.

members.entity_description: Narrative stories and tales, particularly urban legends, used historically to explain unknown and supernatural phenomena and reflecting societal fears and anxieties.
A distant historical period when early explanatory stories about the unknown were told.

args.new_description: Concepts and distinctions between objective reality and invented story content, including facts, fiction, real events, and the blurred boundary between them within narratives.
args.justification: Both classes model the same epistemic distinction between fact, fiction, and their blurred boundary in stories (overlapping descriptions and complementary entities: fact, fiction, real events, line between fact and fiction, truth behind stories), so they should be merged into a single coherent class.
The merged class concerns truth vs. fabrication within stories, which fits a broader group unifying narrative truth, fiction, and their historical context.

This class covers stories and ancient times as explanatory narratives for the unknown, which is closely related in domain to the fact/fiction distinction in narratives and should share the same higher-level Class_Group.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes model the same epistemic distinction between fact, fiction, and their blurred boundary in stories (overlapping descriptions and complementary entities: fact, fiction, real events, line between fact and fiction, truth behind stories), so they should be merged into a single coherent class.
The merged class concerns truth vs. fabrication within stories, which fits a broader group unifying narrative truth, fiction, and their historical context.

This class covers stories and ancient times as explanatory narratives for the unknown, which is closely related in domain to the fact/fiction distinction in narratives and should share the same higher-level Class_Group.
